explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 54degC (ICSC (2004)), which is classified into Category 3. Classified into Class 3, Packing Group III (UN#2303) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: No data available, though containing unsaturated bonds. Classified into Class 3 (UN#2303) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 574degC (ICSC, 2004)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Class 3 (UN#2303) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 4,900mg/kg (SIDS (2002)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of 16mL/kg (equivalent to 14,500mg/kg) (SIDS (2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-2 (2002)): "The substance induced moderate irritation" (though exposure duration is not presented).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (SIDS (2002)): "The substance induced moderate irritation."

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Insufficient data are available, though human epidemiological evidence suggests sensitization for human skin (CERI Hazard Data 2001-40 (2002)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests, germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and germ cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, and positive data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in NTP DB (Access on Mar., 2006), the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1996) and CERI Hazard Data 2001-40 (2002).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Combined studies on repeated dose/reproductive/developmental toxicity suggested adverse developmental effects (litter loss and body weight reduction) at doses inducing maternal toxicity, described in the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1996) and SIDS (2002).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system) May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "irritation of the upper respiratory tract" and the evidence from animal studies: "within 5 minutes, lid closure was observed; by 90 minutes, impaired coordination occurred; by 4 hours, debility; by 5 hours, anesthetic leprosy was observed" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-40 (2002)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.classification: Category 1 (central nervous system), Category 2 (kidney, liver, respiratory system)
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (central nervous system) May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (kidney, liver, respiratory system)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "prolonged exposure by inhalation induces suppression of the central nervous system" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-40 (2002)). Also based on the evidence from animal studies including "increased hyaline droplet and basophilic changes in the renal tubular epithelium, eosinophilic changes in hepatocyte, elevated GPT" (the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1996)), "atrophy and hyperplasia of the nasal mucus-secreting glands, atrophy and hyperplasia of the olfactory epithelium" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48 hours EC50=2.6mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 1996).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 2 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (BCF=140(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 2.
